content: AI models require large, diverse, and accurately labeled datasets for effective training, which can be costly and time-consuming to acquire in real-world scenarios.

verification.summary: Synthetic data helps train AI models by providing large, diverse datasets without the cost and time of real-world data collection. It improves model accuracy and performance but can introduce biases if not carefully designed. Ethical concerns arise from ensuring synthetic data represents real-world scenarios accurately.

verification.summary: Key metrics for evaluating AI models include accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. Precision minimizes false positives, while recall minimizes false negatives. The F1-score is a balance of precision and recall.

content: Accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC are commonly used metrics to evaluate the performance of AI models across various tasks.

verification.summary: Accuracy measures correct predictions, precision assesses true positives, recall evaluates true positives, and F1-score balances precision and recall; AUC-ROC gauges model performance across thresholds.
